intro: Calorophus anceps, commonly known as the narrow-leaved sunflower, is a species of flowering plant native to South America. It belongs to the Asteraceae family, which includes daisies and other composite flowers. The plant is characterized by its narrow, lance-shaped leaves and bright yellow ray florets surrounding a central disk of tubular flowers. It thrives in sunny, well-drained soils and is often found in grasslands and disturbed areas. Calorophus anceps is valued for its ornamental appeal and ecological role in supporting pollinators.
